```{r}
#load libraries

library(tidyverse)
library(haven)
library(tools)

#get_data

start_directory = "./data/raw_data/20200430/Clinical Data/diagnosis.sas7bdat"

#data info: mtime = modified time = will let us know if it's been processed or not
file_info = file.info(start_directory)
last_modified_time = file_info[,"mtime"]

#file_type
file_type = file_ext("./data/raw_data/20200430/Clinical Data/diagnosis.sas7bdat")

#file_size
file_size = file_info[ , "size"]



#load information into an inventory file
file_inventory <- data.frame(file_info, file_type)
  
#behavioral, demographic
#data_structure
#whose_data/ which experiment
#when was it collected? Title
#categorical - in bins how big is the data
```


## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
